meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or development.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outpacing the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: The sports car was outpacing the old truck on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in outpacing him.
meanings.sent4: Her career was outpacing her own expectations, soaring to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outpacing gravity, reaching for the stars.

meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The sprinter was outpacing his competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit was outpacing the turtle in the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The wind playfully teased the kite, outpacing its flight.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be outpacing her, slipping through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The river rushed, outpacing the meandering stream beside it.

meanings.definition: To exceed in growth or progress.
meanings.sent1: The technology sector is outpacing other industries in growth.
meanings.sent2: Her knowledge of the subject was outpacing her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The garden plants were outpacing each other in reaching for the sun.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was outpacing his current position, driving him forward.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was outpacing the firefighters' efforts to contain it.
